title: 2002–03 Rangers F.C. season
text:
The 2002–03 season was the 123rd season of competitive <a href="Association%20football">football</a> by <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a>.
Overview.
Rangers played a total of 50 competitive matches during the 2002–03 season. They won their seventh <a href="Treble%20%28association%20football%29">domestic treble</a> in manager <a href="Alex%20McLeish">Alex McLeish</a>'s first full season in charge, having taken over from <a href="Dick%20Advocaat">Dick Advocaat</a> the previous season. The league championship was won on goal difference in the last match of the season with a 6–1 win against <a href="Dunfermline%20Athletic%20F.C.">Dunfermline Athletic</a>. The club finished on +73 GD, just one ahead of <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a>.
The <a href="Scottish%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a> was won with a 2–1 final win against <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> and the <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a> with a 1–0 win against <a href="Dundee%20F.C.">Dundee</a>. Despite domestic success, Rangers crashed out of Europe at the first round stage to little known <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech</a> team <a href="Victoria%20Zizkov">Victoria Zizkov</a> losing on the away goals rule.
